trans-unit.source: Create a database account - Free Trial | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Create a database account - Free Trial | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to create database accounts using the online service portal for Azure DocumentDB, a managed NoSQL document database for JSON. Get a free trial today.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to create database accounts using the online service portal for Azure DocumentDB, a managed NoSQL document database for JSON. Get a free trial today.

trans-unit.source: Create a DocumentDB database account using the Azure preview portal
trans-unit.target: Create a DocumentDB database account using the Azure preview portal

trans-unit.source: To use Microsoft Azure DocumentDB, you must create a DocumentDB database account by using the Azure preview portal.
trans-unit.target: To use Microsoft Azure DocumentDB, you must create a DocumentDB database account by using the Azure preview portal.

trans-unit.source: Are you new to DocumentDB?
trans-unit.target: Are you new to DocumentDB?

trans-unit.source: Watch <link><linkText>this</linkText><title></title></link> four minute video by Scott Hanselman to see how to complete the most common tasks in the online portal.
trans-unit.target: Watch <link><linkText>this</linkText><title></title></link> four minute video by Scott Hanselman to see how to complete the most common tasks in the online portal.

trans-unit.source: Next steps
trans-unit.target: Next steps

trans-unit.source: Now that you have a DocumentDB account, the next step is to create a DocumentDB database.
trans-unit.target: Now that you have a DocumentDB account, the next step is to create a DocumentDB database.

trans-unit.source: You can create a database by using one of the following:
trans-unit.target: You can create a database by using one of the following:

trans-unit.source: The C# .NET samples in the <link><linkText>DatabaseManagement</linkText><title></title></link> project of the <link><linkText>azure-documentdb-net</linkText><title></title></link> repository on GitHub.
trans-unit.target: The C# .NET samples in the <link><linkText>DatabaseManagement</linkText><title></title></link> project of the <link><linkText>azure-documentdb-net</linkText><title></title></link> repository on GitHub.

trans-unit.source: The preview portal, as described in <link><linkText>Create a DocumentDB database using the Azure preview portal</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: The preview portal, as described in <link><linkText>Create a DocumentDB database using the Azure preview portal</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: The all-inclusive tutorials: <link><linkText>.NET</linkText><title></title></link>, <link><linkText>.NET MVC</linkText><title></title></link>, <link><linkText>Java</linkText><title></title></link>, <link><linkText>Node.js</linkText><title></title></link>, or <link><linkText>Python</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: The all-inclusive tutorials: <link><linkText>.NET</linkText><title></title></link>, <link><linkText>.NET MVC</linkText><title></title></link>, <link><linkText>Java</linkText><title></title></link>, <link><linkText>Node.js</linkText><title></title></link>, or <link><linkText>Python</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: The <link><linkText>DocumentDB SDKs</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: The <link><linkText>DocumentDB SDKs</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: DocumentDB has .NET, Java, Python, Node.js, and JavaScript API SDKs.
trans-unit.target: DocumentDB has .NET, Java, Python, Node.js, and JavaScript API SDKs.

trans-unit.source: After creating your database, you need to <link><linkText>add one or more collections</linkText><title></title></link> to the database, then <link><linkText>add documents</linkText><title></title></link> to the collections.
trans-unit.target: After creating your database, you need to <link><linkText>add one or more collections</linkText><title></title></link> to the database, then <link><linkText>add documents</linkText><title></title></link> to the collections.

trans-unit.source: After you have documents in a collection, you can use <link><linkText>DocumentDB SQL</linkText><title></title></link> to <link><linkText>execute queries</linkText><title></title></link> against your documents by using the <link><linkText>Query Explorer</linkText><title></title></link> in the preview portal, the <link><linkText>REST API</linkText><title></title></link>, or one of the <link><linkText>SDKs</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: After you have documents in a collection, you can use <link><linkText>DocumentDB SQL</linkText><title></title></link> to <link><linkText>execute queries</linkText><title></title></link> against your documents by using the <link><linkText>Query Explorer</linkText><title></title></link> in the preview portal, the <link><linkText>REST API</linkText><title></title></link>, or one of the <link><linkText>SDKs</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: To learn more about DocumentDB, explore these resources:
trans-unit.target: To learn more about DocumentDB, explore these resources:

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>Learning map for DocumentDB</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Learning map for DocumentDB</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>DocumentDB resource model and concepts</linkText><title></title></link>
